availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Winslow Abbett (Shelby County, Kentucky, Methodist preacher)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, Methodist preacher. Kentucky native. Son of William Mc Abbett and Margaret Abbett. Married Mariah Elizabeth West Abbett in Nicholas County, Kentucky on January 27, 1864. Graduate of Dickinson College in Pennsylvania in 1860. Methodist preacher in Shelby County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 240.Find A Grave, "Henry Winslow (May 10, 1839-January 19, 1919)," Memorial #24269755, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/24269755 (accessed January 29, 2020). Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County Marriages, Film 000252411. “Abbett, Henry Winslow,” The Civil War Research Engine at Dickinson College, http://hd.housedivided.dickinson.edu/node/4949 (accessed January 29, 2020). KYR-0001-028-0058.
